title: Public Records Request for Dept. of Elementary and Secondary Education Data

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Dept. of Elementary and Secondary Education Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your school district. Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection.
A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”
A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”
I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):
1.	Any and all documents relating to or filed in connection with school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request such documents produced to include, but not limited to, the following columns:

a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement
b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement
c. Charge (or charges)
d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement
e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school.
k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and
l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.

2.	If such a production of the documents in question 1 is not possible, please provide any reports, incident notes, status updates, or documents which were submitted to DESE as the result of a school based arrest or any such referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement or arrest, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0.

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.”

Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d).
The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety.
If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.
Sincerely,

Heather Atherton
Research Assistant
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Heather Atherton

communications.subject: Re: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Dept. of Elementary and Secondary Education Data
communications.communication:
Hello and hope all is well.

Much of the information that you are requesting in your public record request is already publicly available on the DESE Website.  The link allows you to go back to the 2012-2013 school year and you can also search by district and individual school.

The link is as follows:

https://profiles.doe.mass.edu/ssdr/default.aspx?orgcode=01600000&fycode=2023&dropDownOrgCode=2

As to any information that cannot be found on the link, we have shared your request with the City of Lowell/Lowell Police Department, so that they can respond to the extent that they have said information.    Just in case, the direct link is https://lowellpolice.org/public-records-request/  and/or RAO@LowellMA.gov<mailto:rao@lowellma.gov>.

If you have any questions or concerns, please let me know.

Thanks and my best

Mike Ortiz
Public Records Officer
Lowell Public Schools
978-674-2123

 Lynn Public Schools | Public Records Request

communications.subject: PRA 24-163: California Public Records Act Request: Beverage Agreements (California State University, Fresno)
communications.communication:
Dear Kelly North:

We received your July 16, 2024, Public Records Act request for the
following records:

"Agreements related to the beverage pouring rights, distribution, or sales
on campus or in athletics venues or facilities. Including any related
exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas."

The activity and related records for your request are administered by the
California State University, Fresno Association, Inc. (Association), an
auxiliary organization that is a separate entity from the university and
runs in accordance with California Education Code Sections 89900, et seq.,
and Title V of the California Code of Regulations, Sections 42400, et seq.
As such, this response is also sent on behalf of the Association pursuant
to the Richard McKee Transparency Act of 2011.

The Association conducted a reasonable search for records under California
Government Code §7922.535 and Education Code §89914.5 and determined that
your request either in whole or in part, seeks copies of disclosable public
records and makes available to you any that are public.

The standard duplication rate has been established at 20 cents per page,
irrespective of whether records are produced in hard or electronic format.
In this instance, there is no charge as there was no need to copy/convert
the documents to a PDF in response to your request. The records were
already in PDF format and are attached to this email.

If you have any questions, I can be reached via email or by phone at
559.278.7461.

Sincerely,

Esther
Esther Gonzalez
Office of the Vice President for Administration
California State University, Fresno
Phone: 559.278.7461 <(559)%20278-7461>

title: Former Chief Del Papa "mutual agreement" to end term

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Former Chief Del Papa "mutual agreement" to end term
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide any town records, correspondences and emails regarding the administrative leave, subsequent Abington Police internal investigation and resignation of Joshua Heal between December 1, 2021 and March 30, 2023. Please provide Abington town records, corespondences, emails regarding adminstraive decisions incurred by former Chief Del Papa regarding Josh Heal between December 2021 and March 30, 2023, as well as the terms of Cheif Del Papa's "mutual agreement" also known as "separation agreement" intiated on May 3, 2024 and announced by the Town of Abington on May 7, 2024.

Please include records/ reports including "Allen Consulting Services," as well as transcripts and email correspondences including Selectman Alex Hagerty, Town Manager Scott Lambiase, School Committe Chair Chris Coyle, Selectman Roger Woods and Selectman Kevin Donovan.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Susanne Cleveland

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N016294-101024
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
10/28/2024 
Miriam Bhimani 
Dear Miriam Bhimani: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N016294-101024 
Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

A log of all emails to/from the CPS Board Chair, from September 1, 2024 to September 30, 2024. 

1. Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment. 

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fcps-board-chair-september-2024-174297%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1sz57K%3AzmFrWI0q-GGgQRXqQ3QlkzXhRml2LBC5eQGrzaT_c9M 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. Section 7(1)(f) exempts from release “Preliminary drafts, notes, recommendations, memoranda and other records in which opinions are expressed, or policies or actions are formulated, except that a specific record or relevant portion of a record shall not be exempt when the record is publicly cited and identified by the head of the public body.” [5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(f)]. Student information has been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r) which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA generally prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at is direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored.” (105 ILCS 10/2(d). Redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a). This section exempts from disclosure "[i]nformation specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law." 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a). Redactions have also been made pursuant to IL Supreme Court rule 766. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: DHS/CISA: 2023 National Cyber Awareness System Bulletin Budget

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DHS/CISA: 2023 National Cyber Awareness System Bulletin Budget
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The amount of money allocated by Department of Homeland Security (DHS) / Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) to fund the generation and publication of the National Cyber Awareness System Bulletins (reference: https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/bulletins) for the 2023 calendar year. This includes personnel, materials, computers, hours required, and applicable expenditures related to the publication of the "SB" bulletins, and only those bulletins. If it is easier to determine the cost to generate a single weekly bulletin (e.g. https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/bulletins/sb21-046) then I can extrapolate a rough cost for the year and that is acceptable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Martin

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The amount of money allocated by Department of Homeland Security (DHS) / Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) to fund the ICS-CERT program (reference: https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics) for the 2023 calendar year. This includes personnel, materials, computers, and applicable expenditures such as travel. This request is for records *specific to ICS-CERT*, not the larger US-CERT program.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Martin

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Dan Lauber
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documents, communications, or other responsive records related to the procurement, execution, and delivery of services between City of Coral Springs and Dan Lauber.

Pursuant to Article I, section 24 of the Florida Constitution, and chapter 119, F.S., this request is to include all communications between Mr. Lauber and the City leading up to the execution of a contract (including initial outreach by the City or Mr. Lauber) and continuing to the present which pertain to the services procured and the execution of those services.
 
This also includes the executed contract, and any addendums, extensions, or other components of the agreement between Coral Springs and Mr. Lauber.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Martin Nash

 Architectural and Engineering plans that are under seal in accordance with Florida Statute Section 481.221 or 471.025, and held by a public agency in connection with a transaction of official business are subject to inspection and copying in accordance with Florida Statute 119.07(1). Kyra Fields

title: Request for Off-Duty Payroll Records (Memphis Police Department)

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Request for Off-Duty Payroll Records (Memphis Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A dataset of all approved applications from officers to the Off-Duty Work Detail Department for outside employment that includes the following columns:
- Date of application
- Names of officers
- Private employer
2. Payroll records including hours worked from private employers of authorized off-duty police officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Aspen Ford.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: W032027-092324
communications.communication:
Mx Hoover: 
 
We have received your request for a public record. It is our goal to respond to these requests as soon as possible or within 5 business days. However, please note that certain requests may take longer to process due to the size of the records requested or current request volumes. In these cases, you will receive a notice within 5 business days letting you know additional time is needed and when your next update will occur. Your request has been given the following reference number W032027-092324 for tracking purposes. 
 
Record Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A dataset of all approved applications from officers to the Off-Duty Work Detail Department for outside employment that includes the following columns:
- Date of application
- Names of officers
- Private employer
2. Payroll records including hours worked from private employers of authorized off-duty police officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

title: Last Meal information and receipts for Richard Glossip

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Last Meal information and receipts for Richard Glossip
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Procurement information related to the three “last meals” for the death row inmate Richard Glossip. Detailed requests below.

1. Oklahoma's Institutional Level Purchasing /Procurement Policies

Documents
I would like to see all documented purchasing policies for last meals (see below for specific questions I would like answered.) 
(What is the approval process for last meal choices? 
Is there cost limit per meal? 
How are special, more expensive ingredient approved? 
Does the warden join the prisoner for the last meal, and if so do they also get a meal provided?
- If the meal isn’t prepared onsite, who picks up the meal (for example, at KFC)
- And in this case, does the staff member request reimbursement or do they use a credit card? 
- What is the Expense reimbursement process

2. Specific Meal information for Richard Glossip

Receipts
Records of meals for each of his three meals
 - if made ineernally, detailed ingredient list)
- Cost / Payment information for the meal: kitchen staff time allocated to preparing the meal and grocery costs 
If bought externally
- Physical receipts or scanned copies of receipts  
- Cost / Payment information for any off-site meal purchases (ex; bucket of KFC chicken) and any relevant documentation, including emails associated with the meals

Also, any information regarding the food or meals that Glossip had for his two marriages, including documentation and receipts

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Margot Hanley

communications.subject: RE: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Last Meal information and receipts for Richard Glossip
communications.communication:

I wanted to follow up on the following Oklahoma Open Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Oct. 8, 2024. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of

Suspect Name: Alto Miles
Description/Headline: Suspect arrested in pair of double homicides in Cincinnati
Link of the Article: https://www.wtol.com/article/news/crime/ohio-cincinnati-suspect-arrested-double-homicide/512-096a8e8a-6ffa-43b5-bd5e-26b01e48989a
State: Ohio 
Law Enforcement: Cincinnati police

included but not limited to the following:
Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case
Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.

If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

david yupa

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Occupational Safety and Health Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Occupational Safety and Health Administration)
communications.communication:
Dear Occupational Safety and Health Administration,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Occupational Safety and Health Administration's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
Hello:

Your request has been assigned to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) with tracking number 2025-F-01075. When they begin processing it, you will be able to track its progress at https://efoia.dol.gov/App/CheckStatus.aspx. If you need to contact them about it for any reason, please submit your inquiry through osha.foia@dol.gov<mailto:osha.foia@dol.gov> or phone 202-693-1999. In addition, it would be helpful to include the tracking number in the Subject line of any email submission to have it available at the time of the call.

Sincerely,


Glenn Lewis
Government Information Specialist
Office of Information Services (OIS)
Division of Management and Administrative Legal Services (MALS)
U.S. Department of Labor, Office of the Solicitor
200 Constitution Ave NW,  Room N2424, Washington DC 20210

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of

Suspect Name: Darrell Brooks
Description/Headline: Darrell Brooks Found Guilty of Murder in Wisconsin Parade Killings
Link of the Article: https://www.theepochtimes.com/us/darrell-brooks-found-guilty-of-murder-in-wisconsin-parade-killings-4821979?utm_medium=GoogleAds&utm_source=PerfmaxM&utm_campaign=PM_max_Marshalfugitive_Cons8a_20240930&gclid=CjwKCAjwg-24BhB_EiwA1ZOx8gCkhCejWImHmr-v7xP8-6BPUNbxkZF-tY7xJBJmex_oyQv9-TPd0BoCSNcQAvD_BwE&welcomeuser=1
State: Wisconsin
Law Enforcement: Waukesha

included but not limited to the following:
Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case
Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.

If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

david yupa

communications.subject: RE: *EMAIL TO WKPD-openrecords* Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials
communications.communication:
Good morning,

All records regarding this incident can be found on the City of Waukesha’s website.

https://www.waukesha-wi.gov/government/departments/police-department.php

If you scroll to the bottom of the page on the left-hand side you will see “2021 Christmas Parade Records”.

Court records would need to be requested through the Waukesha County courthouse.

Thank you,

[cid:image001.png@01DB292E.B07CE090]

Karen Deakin Kunstmann
Waukesha Police Department
1901 Delafield St.
Waukesha, WI. 53188
262-524-3770

Our Mission:  A Pledge to Serve with Integrity, Honor and Courage!

“The opinions expressed are mine and do not necessarily represent those of the City of Waukesha.”

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: Columbia ShotSpotter Contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract (i.e. council resolution, contract extension, contract amendments, cure notices, or other revisions to agreements) between the city and SoundThinking, Inc., formerly ShotSpotter, Inc.. This document(s) should include the total cost over the life of the contract and the current expiration date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sophia Ludt

communications.subject: RE: FOIA Received # 24-25-0689; South Carolina Public Records Law Request: Columbia ShotSpotter Contract
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,



Thank you for contacting the City of Columbia Attorney’s Office.  Your request for information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, S.C. Code § 30-4-10 et. seq., has been received and forwarded to the appropriate department for review.  Please be advised that § 30-4-30(b) of the South Carolina Code authorizes a public body to “establish and collect fees” for providing information pursuant to a Freedom of Information Act request.  Prior to providing pertinent documentation, we will notify you of any fees associated with your request.



Once all documentation has been compiled and reviewed, non-exempt documents will be forwarded to you within 30 days, unless otherwise stated.



Effective May 19, 2017, it is a crime to knowingly obtain or use information obtained from a public body for commercial solicitation, S.C. Code § 30-2-50 et. seq.



Please feel free to contact our office if we may be of further assistance.



Sincerely,


Elizabeth Williams
Office of the City Attorney
1401 Main Street
P.O. Box 667
Columbia, SC 29202
Main Office: 803-737-0000 | Fax: 803-737-4250

[cid:image001.png@01DA9B17.5C557B30]

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Response:  24-25-0689; South Carolina Public Records Law Request: Columbia ShotSpotter Contract
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

Your request for information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, S.C. Code 30-4-10 Ct. seq., concerning the above-referenced matter, was received in the Office of the City Attorney on October 11, 2024 and forwarded to the City of Columbia Procurement and Contracts Department for response.

Please find enclosed documents which contain information regarding the abovementioned request.  Please be advised some information has been redacted as it is exempt from release under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) pursuant to S.C. Code §30-4-40 (a) (2).


Effective May 19, 2017, it is a crime to knowingly obtain or use information obtained from a public body for commercial solicitation, S.C. Code § 30-2-50 et. seq.



Please feel free to contact our office if we may be of further assistance.



Sincerely,


Elizabeth Williams
Office of the City Attorney
1401 Main Street
P.O. Box 667
Columbia, SC 29202

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Beverage agreements (Rhode Island College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities, including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

communications.subject: RE: [External]  Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Beverage agreements (Rhode Island College)
communications.communication:
Good morning Alexa,

I received your request for public records below that was forwarded to my attention and received by me on the business day of Thursday, October 24, 2024 and we will start processing your request immediately with a response to follow within the next 10 business days by November 7, 2024. We kindly request future requests be sent directly to apra@ric.edu<mailto:apra@ric.edu> to ensure they are received directly by the college's Public Records Officials. Please visit our Access to Public Records Act (APRA) request | Rhode Island College<https://www.ric.edu/department-directory/office-institutional-research-and-planning/access-public-records-act-apra-request> webpage for guidelines and information and also attached is a request form that they can used to submit requests for public records. The form is not required.

Thank you,


Greg Stewart
Rhode Island College
Public Records Officer

title: O9A and Other Hate Group Documents

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: O9A and Other Hate Group Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any and all investigative and non-investigative records, including cross-referenced records, mentioning, referring to or pertaining to the Order of Nine Angles (O9A/ONA).
2. Any and all investigative and non-investigative records, including cross-referenced records, mentioning, referring to or pertaining to the group Satanic Front in Azle, Texas.
3. Any and all investigative and non-investigative records, including cross-referenced records, mentioning, referring to or pertaining to the usernames CommandantCultus, Commandant Cultus, or ccultus.com.
4. Any and all investigative and non-investigative records, including cross-referenced records, mentioning, referring to or pertaining to the group New Resistance based in Boston.

Please interpret the scope of this request broadly. Your agency is instructed to interpret the scope of this request in the most liberal manner possible short of an interpretation that would lead to a conclusion that the request does not reasonably describe the records sought.

Please conduct searches for cross-referenced records. Please additionally conduct searches of:
- SENTINEL
- Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR), Microphone Surveillance (MISUR), Physical Surveillance (FISUR) and Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records/indices
- Investigative Data Warehouse (IDW), including IDW-S, SPT, and DOCLAB-S sub-systems/indices
- Data Integration and Visualization System (DIVS)
- Law Enforcement National Data Exchange (N-DEx)
- Counterdrug Information Indices System (CIIS)

If any responsive or cross-referenced records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, please provide all records related/pursuant to their destruction/transfer. This includes but is not limited to:
- Confirmation of destruction and destruction slips
- File Numbers or other forms of ID of the aforementioned destroyed records
- Records with any references to the destruction of the aforementioned destroyed records
- Transfer slips
- Any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the your agency has no other copies of said records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

ZN

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am limiting my request to the free two hours of searching and 100 duplicated
pages. I am not willing to pay additional fees.

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    1. Any and all investigative and non-investigative records, including
    cross-referenced records, mentioning, referring to or pertaining to the
    Order of Nine Angles (O9A/ONA).
    2. Any and all investigative and non-investigative records, including
    cross-referenced records, mentioning, referring to or pertaining to the
    group Satanic Front in Azle, Texas.
    3. Any and all investigative and non-investigative records, including
    cross-referenced records, mentioning, referring to or pertaining to the
    usernames CommandantCultus, Commandant Cultus, or ccultus.com.
    4. Any and all investigative and non-investigative records, including
    cross-referenced records, mentioning, referring to or pertaining to the
    group New Resistance based in Boston.
    
    Please interpret the scope of this request broadly. Your agency is
    instructed to interpret the scope of this request in the most liberal manner
    possible short of an interpretation that would lead to a conclusion that the
    request does not reasonably describe the records sought.
    
    Please conduct searches for cross-referenced records. Please additionally
    conduct searches of:
    - SENTINEL
    - Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR), Microphone Surveillance (MISUR), Physical
    Surveillance (FISUR) and Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records/indices
    - Investigative Data Warehouse (IDW), including IDW-S, SPT, and DOCLAB-S
    sub-systems/indices
    - Data Integration and Visualization System (DIVS)
    - Law Enforcement National Data Exchange (N-DEx)
    - Counterdrug Information Indices System (CIIS)
    
    If any responsive or cross-referenced records have been destroyed and/or
    transferred to NARA, please provide all records related/pursuant to their
    destruction/transfer. This includes but is not limited to:
    - Confirmation of destruction and destruction slips
    - File Numbers or other forms of ID of the aforementioned destroyed records
    - Records with any references to the destruction of the aforementioned
    destroyed records
    - Transfer slips
    - Any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said
    transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that
    the your agency has no other copies of said records.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    ZN

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Ira Einhorn
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Ira Samuel Einhorn (May 15, 1940 - April 3, 2020). Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/07/us/ira-einhorn-dead.html Records on Einhorn are likely to exist as Einhorn was a fugitive from 1981 to 1997.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters and the Paris LEGAT. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1616531-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request

If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-0] please enter [1195846-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-1] please enter [1195846-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000
Case Type:
FOIPA
Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)

The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.

You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Our complex requests are further divided into small (51-250 pages), medium (251-500 pages), large (501-4,999), and extra-large (over 5,000 pages) sub-tracks.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing. Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process.

Currently, simple track cases average approximately 122 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Complex requests in the small processing track are currently averaging 360 days from the date of receipt for processing, those in the medium processing track are currently averaging 1,230 days, those in the large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,010 days, and those in the extra-large track are averaging 2,370 days.

Respectfully,


Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Oakland Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Oakland Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kyra Fields

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III." 

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Rock

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129

Dear Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for your response! My name is Rebecca Burns and my colleague Julia Rock and I are reporters at The Lever, a national investigative outlet. I am making this request as part of ongoing reporting into water issues in the American West. This request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

My mailing address is 4521 N Central Park Ave. 3W, Chicago IL 60625. My phone number is 781-962-8816. Please feel free to give me a call if it's helpful to discuss any portion of this request. 

Thank you!

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

communications.communication:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Wesley Lowery.

title: Oklahoma State Department of Education - "Patriotic Displays" guidance

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Oklahoma State Department of Education - "Patriotic Displays" guidance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of the guidance issued to school districts concerning "Patriotic Displays," as referenced in the August 29, 2024 press release by Ryan Walters and/or the Oklahoma State Department of Education.

2. A copy of any report submitted by any district detailing their policies regarding the display of the U.S. flag and the weekly recitation of the Pledge of Allegiance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Welcome to Smartsheet!
communications.communication:
Welcome! Now let’s get started

Your first step as a new Guest or Viewer is to access the item shared with you in Smartsheet and collaborate. That could mean adding a comment, making an edit, or simply viewing what was shared.

Log in now ➝ <https://go.smartsheet.com/dc/E4bccTNLDr0GJTjCKMX6SB-NH5ZiyxNt_DEvgNE1neI-UPMbq4ZbqbidwJnDw7J5oOWRaNGVsCOFFYxK6UG4pRDfGEjeDK4vMiZiEqDtX82HWD6xUbTL0osxdySfKGups41-aiWXnwp35oUmLaqjwRtVToN91A8xuypV4SFadOw=/NDY0LU9OTS0xNDkAAAGVRvwfYWLAE_gianR0axePaUOop1uM9sBLHxDSDiU83qhwsZ9nwdau_fvz6bO7zM415MVkvF0=>

What is Smartsheet?

Smartsheet is the enterprise platform for work management. We help teams plan work, do work, scale work, and enable anyone to drive meaningful change.

communications.subject: Learn how
communications.communication:
Learn how to work in Smartsheet

Our webinar for Guest and Viewers is the fastest and easiest way to learn how to use Smartsheet

Play the webinar → https://go.smartsheet.com/dc/wIQmyGhXZM4DmbvAyzH4NeaUth_uka6AQkCT1l4R7nQhZTVQLm8jP7ntKdjTILw5IbmzXrtJ51ehPPDww9TJL0BQNeESXnf9LO0RRta0MHNEKmCSXofKQTcawFGiodF9fviRUou-rzuQXtDTZiMTfwPXxo4ddCRheUaqXGjMzNBFu6EgbQTrPLBr2rqy4GxEEpSRyQJqZmB66ZdWCQ-u-g==/NDY0LU9OTS0xNDkAAAGVU1sV56jR1ZmHopZ3as3OTEflieji-jFzwwPqMoezzEwGytfd4aSv3QhFiKtgeajuSxVUR5Q=

--

What is a Guest and Viewer?

There are three primary types of users in Smartsheet, all with unique capabilities. If you’d like to create your own work and have greater access you’ll need to upgrade to a free trial or be granted Member access by a System Admin.

PLATFORM ACCESS
- Guest & Viewer: Free on someone else’s paid plan
- Trial Users: Free for 30 days
- Member: Buy a subscription or license granted Member access by organization

KEEP THE ITEMS YOU CREATE
- Guest & Viewer: Requires upgrade for full capability
- Trial Users: Requires upgrade
- Member: Yes

VIEW, EDIT, AND SHARE SHEETS*
- Guest & Viewers: Included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

ATTACH DOCUMENTS*
- Guest & Viewer: Included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

COMMUNICATE WITH CONVERSATIONS AND PROOFING*
- Guest & Viewer: Included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

CREATE SHEETS, COLUMNS, AND FORMS
- Guest & Viewer: Not included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

CREATE OR USE PRE-MADE TEMPLATES
- Guest & Viewer: Not included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

CREATE DASHBOARDS, PORTALS, AND REPORTS
- Guest & Viewer: Not included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

BUILD AUTOMATED WORKFLOWS
- Guest & Viewer: Not included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

--

*Guests and Viewers with Internal Admin or Editor permissions have the same access. Users with Viewer permissions can only view.

--

communications.subject: Take the next step
communications.communication:
Why you should consider upgrading

While there are many reasons users upgrade, the primary reason is to create and manage their own work in Smartsheet. Before upgrading, there are a few things you can do to make your experience even more successful: 

 - Learn how to use Smartsheet through our educational offerings.
 - Determine how Smartsheet can help you save time and improve collaboration.
 - Read our article about how to get Member access in Smartsheet, and more.

title: NYC Bail Fund Management Audit 2018 (Office of the Comptroller of New York City)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYC Bail Fund Management Audit 2018 (Office of the Comptroller of New York City)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All reports, summaries, and letters from the January 1–June 30, 2018 audit of the New York City Department of Finance's bail fund management.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

communications.communication:
This letter is in reference to your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request that our office received on June 21, 2024.

Comptroller's Office staff are searching for records responsive to your FOIL request. Due to the volume of FOIL requests that our agency is handling; the limited agency staff processing thousands of FOIL requests; and the voluminous nature of your request, we need more time to respond to your request. Accordingly, we anticipate completing our response to your FOIL request by October 25, 2024. If circumstances arise that necessitate an extension beyond this date, we will notify you.

If you have any questions regarding your request, please send an email to our FOIL Officer at foil@comptroller.nyc.gov<mailto:foil@comptroller.nyc.gov>.

Sincerely,
NYC Comptroller's Office FOIL Unit

communications.subject: RE: FOIL Request - New Submission
communications.communication:
Your Freedom of Information Law ("FOIL") request, dated June 21, 2024, sought the following records from the Office of the New York City Comptroller:



"All reports, summaries, and letters from the January 1-June 30, 2018 audit of the New York City Department of Finance's bail fund management."


Your request is granted. Your request for "reports, summaries, and letters" regarding the referenced June 21, 2019 Letter Report on the Department of Finance's Bail Fund Management is granted. The records are attached.



Note that internal memoranda created by Comptroller's Office's Bureau of Audit staff summarizing interviews and meetings conducted for this audit report have been withheld. These internal agency records may be permissibly withheld under N.Y.S. POL § 87(2)(g), which exempts inter- and intra-agency communications that are not (i) statistical or factual tabulations or data; (ii) instructions to staff that affect the public; (iii) final agency policy or determinations; or (iv) external audits.  Although inter-agency materials are "not defined under the FOIL statute, New York's courts have construed this term to mean deliberative material, i.e., communications exchanged for discussion purposes not constituting final policy decisions."  Russo v. Nassau Cty. Cmty. Coll., 81 N.Y.2d 690, 699 (1993); see also Tuck-It-Away Assocs., L.P. v. Empire State Dev. Corp., 54 A.D.3d 154, 166 (App. Div. 1st Dep't 2008) ("the purpose of the intra-agency exemption [is] to permit people within an agency to exchange opinions, advice and criticism freely and frankly, without the chilling prospect of public disclosure"); Gould v. New York City Police Department, 89 N.Y.2d 267, 277 (1986) (inter-agency materials are exempt from FOIL production if such materials include "opinions, ideas, or advice exchanged as part of the consultative or deliberative process of government decision making."). Accordingly, portions of the record where Comptroller's Office staff exchanged thoughts, opinions, and non-final drafts internally as part of the deliberative process of government decision-making have been withheld under N.Y.S. POL § 87(2)(g).



Under N.Y.S. Public Officers Law § 89(4), you have the right to appeal. Appeals must be submitted within 30 calendar days of receipt of this response and should be submitted by email to FOIL@comptroller.nyc.gov<mailto:FOIL@comptroller.nyc.gov>. Please put "FOIL Appeal" in the email's subject field. Appeals may also be mailed to the following address:



FOIL Appeals Officer

New York City Comptroller's Office

Office of the General Counsel

One Centre Street, Suite 602

New York, NY 10007



If you have any questions regarding your request, please send an email to our FOIL Officer at foil@comptroller.nyc.gov<mailto:foil@comptroller.nyc.gov>.



Sincerely,

NYC Comptroller's Office FOIL Unit

Please note that certain private information was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools
